p: Bacteria, another infectious disease causative agent, are prokaryotic single-cell microorganisms. They are classified according to their morphology and the Gram stain reaction ( 30). An example of a bacterial infectious disease would be cholera, caused by Vibrio cholerae, a gram-negative bacterium. It is an old disease, which has been the cause of seven pandemics throughout human history, the first being dated in 1817 ( 50, 51).
